Martin Fowler spoke at the Atlanta Java User's Group meeting a month 
ago, and I noticed him using an assertFile( string, file ) method in 
his junit tests (he was giving a live refactoring demo).  I 
thought "wow, how useful, I didn't know that method was in junit."  
Unfortunately, it isn't.

A quick search of this list found a few messages asking for assertFile
( file1, file2 ) but nothing else.

Are there any plans to add the two types of assertFile?  I know you 
have to be careful about kitchen sink syndrome, but I think the two 
assertFile methods would be useful.  I frequently test results from a 
method that returns several lines of string data, and I'd much rather 
have the correct data in a file, than inline (it clutters up the 
code).

Comments?
